newsitem.title: DUBAI: PRESS DIGEST - United Arab Emirates - June 29.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - United Arab Emirates - June 29.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the United Arab Emirates (UAE) press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Dubai police seize 51 kg of narcotic tablets from villa, arrest five people.
- UAE banks perform well, net profits rise 14.6 percent and customer deposits grow 14 percent in 1996.
- Local companies make headway in developing Arabic software as high level of piracy discourages foreign companies from developing products geared for the market.
- Many international companies say they will take part in Dubai's airshow in November.
- Kuwait Airways and Gulf Air told to sell Indian airline stakes.
- UAE oil minister says UAE committed to abiding by its OPEC production quota.
- UAE deputy prime minister Sheikh Sultan meets Morocco's King Hassan.
- Abu Dhabi and Dubai become more expensive, now ranked 74th most expensive cities in the world.
- Britain's Inchcape Plc to invest 45 million dirhams in Jebel Ali free zone to set up a regional distribution centre for the Middle East.
